verses.text: Then Joshua called the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh,
and said unto them, Ye have kept all that Moses the servant of the \sc Lord\sc* commanded you, and have obeyed my voice in all that I commanded you:
ye have not left your brethren these many days unto this day, but have kept the charge of the commandment of the \sc Lord\sc* your God.

And now the \sc Lord\sc* your God hath given rest unto your brethren, as he promised them: therefore now return ye, and get ye unto your tents, \add and\add* unto the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of the \sc Lord\sc* gave you on the \add other\add* side Jordan.

But take diligent heed to do the commandment and the law, which Moses the servant of the \sc Lord\sc* charged you, to love the \sc Lord\sc* your God, and to walk in all his ways, and to keep his commandments, and to cleave unto him, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.
So Joshua blessed them, and sent them away: and they went unto their tents.

Now to the \add one\add* half of the tribe of Manasseh Moses had given \add possession\add* in Bashan: but unto the \add other\add* half thereof gave Joshua among their brethren on \add this\add* side Jordan westward. And when Joshua sent them away also unto their tents, then he blessed them,

and he spake unto them, saying, Return with much riches unto your tents, and with very much cattle, with silver, and with gold, and with brass, and with iron, and with very much raiment: divide the spoil of your enemies with your brethren.

And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh returned, and departed from the children of Israel out of Shiloh, which \add is\add* in the land of Canaan, to go unto the country of Gilead, to the land of their possession, whereof they were possessed, according to the word of the \sc Lord\sc* by the hand of Moses.

And when they came unto the borders of Jordan, that \add are\add* in the land of Canaan, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh built there an altar by Jordan, a great altar to see to.

And the children of Israel heard say, Behold, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh have built an altar over against the land of Canaan, in the borders of Jordan, at the passage of the children of Israel.
And when the children of Israel heard \add of it\add*, the whole congregation of the children of Israel gathered themselves together \add at\add* Shiloh, to go up to war against them.
And the children of Israel sent unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh, into the land of Gilead, Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest,
and with him ten princes, of each chief house a prince throughout all the tribes of Israel; and each one \add was\add* a head of the house of their fathers among the thousands of Israel.
And they came unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh, unto the land of Gilead, and they spake with them, saying,

Thus saith the whole congregation of the \sc Lord\sc*, What trespass \add is\add* this that ye have committed against the God of Israel, to turn away \add this\add* day from following the \sc Lord\sc*, in that ye have builded you an altar, that ye might rebel \add this\add* day against the \sc Lord\sc*?
\add Is\add* the iniquity of Peor \add too\add* little for us, from which we are not cleansed until this day, although there was a plague in the congregation of the \sc Lord\sc*,

but that ye must turn away \add this\add* day from following the \sc Lord\sc*? and it will be, \add seeing\add* ye rebel to day against the \sc Lord\sc*, that to morrow he will be wroth with the whole congregation of Israel.

Notwithstanding, if the land of your possession \add be\add* unclean, \add then\add* pass ye over unto the land of the possession of the \sc Lord\sc*, wherein the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* tabernacle dwelleth, and take possession among us: but rebel not against the \sc Lord\sc*, nor rebel against us, in building you an altar beside the altar of the \sc Lord\sc* our God.
Did not Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in the accursed thing, and wrath fell on all the congregation of Israel? and that man perished not alone in his iniquity.
Then the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh answered, and said unto the heads of the thousands of Israel,

The \sc Lord\sc* God of gods, the \sc Lord\sc* God of gods, he knoweth, and Israel he shall know; if \add it be\add* in rebellion, or if in transgression against the \sc Lord\sc*, (save us not this day,)

that we have built us an altar to turn from following the \sc Lord\sc*; or if to offer thereon burnt offering or meat offering, or if to offer peace offerings thereon, let the \sc Lord\sc* himself require \add it;\add*

and if we have not \add rather\add* done it for fear of \add this\add* thing, saying, In time to come your children might speak unto our children, saying, What have you to do with the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel?

For the \sc Lord\sc* hath made Jordan a border between us and you, ye children of Reuben and children of Gad; ye have no part in the \sc Lord\sc*: so shall your children make our children cease from fearing the \sc Lord\sc*:
therefore we said, Let us now prepare to build us an altar, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice:

but \add that\add* it \add may be\add* a witness between us, and you, and our generations after us, that \add we\add* might do the service of the \sc Lord\sc* before him with our burnt offerings, and with our sacrifices, and with our peace offerings; that your children may not say to our children in time to come, Ye have no part in the \sc Lord\sc*.

Therefore said we, that it shall be, when they should \add so\add* say to us or to our generations in time to come, that we may say \add again\add*, Behold the pattern of the altar of the \sc Lord\sc*, which our fathers made, not for burnt offerings, nor for sacrifices; but it \add is\add* a witness between us and you.

God forbid that we should rebel against the \sc Lord\sc*, and turn \add this\add* day from following the \sc Lord\sc*, to build an altar for burnt offerings, for meat offerings, or for sacrifices, besides the altar of the \sc Lord\sc* our God that \add is\add* before his tabernacle.

And when Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation and heads of the thousands of Israel which \add were\add* with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spake, it pleased them.

And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the children of Manasseh, \add This\add* day we perceive that the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* among us, because ye have not committed this trespass against the \sc Lord\sc*: now ye have delivered the children of Israel out of the hand of the \sc Lord\sc*.

And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, and the princes, returned from the children of Reuben, and from the children of Gad, out of the land of Gilead, unto the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and brought them word again.

And the thing pleased the children of Israel; and the children of Israel blessed God, and did not intend to go up against them in battle, to destroy the land wherein the children of Reuben and Gad dwelt.
And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad called the altar \add Ed:\add* for it \add shall be\add* a witness between us that the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* God.
